meanings.definition: Relating to the patterns of rhythm and sound in poetry.
meanings.sent1: Her prosodical reading of the poem emphasized the musical flow of the words.
meanings.sent2: The prosodical structure of the sonnet created a melodic quality to the verses.
meanings.sent3: The prosodical dance of the words made the poem sound like a song.
meanings.sent4: His prosodical voice painted a rhythmic picture with each line he recited.
meanings.sent5: The prosodical nature of the poem made it easy to remember and recite.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study of poetic meters and versification.
meanings.sent1: The prosodical analysis of the poem revealed its intricate meter and rhyme scheme.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the prosodical aspects of poetry, focusing on its structure and form.
meanings.sent3: The prosodical investigation of the sonnet led to a deeper appreciation of its craftsmanship.
meanings.sent4: His prosodical expertise allowed him to identify the poet's unique style.
meanings.sent5: Studying the prosodical elements of the verse helped her understand its poetic beauty.

meanings.definition: Involving the intonation and stress patterns of speech.
meanings.sent1: Her prosodical speech made her storytelling engaging and captivating.
meanings.sent2: The prosodical delivery of the speech highlighted the emotional nuances of the message.
meanings.sent3: His prosodical tone added a touch of drama to the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The prosodical rhythm of his voice made the lecture more interesting.
meanings.sent5: Listening to her prosodical intonations was like listening to a musical performance.
